itemDescription: British historian, archaeologist, and museum curator

wikipedia_page.main: Edward Alexander Impey,  (born 28 May 1962) is a British historian, archaeologist, and museum curator. Since October 2013, he has been Master of the Armouries and Director General of the Royal Armouries.

response: The head of the Royal Armouries is known as the Master of the Armouries. This was an ancient office that was revived in 1935 when the Royal Armouries became a national museum. The current Director General and Master of the Armouries is Edward Impey.
*Meirion-Jones, Gwyn, Edward Impey and Michael Jones. (eds) (2002) The Seigneurial Residence in Western Europe AD c800-1600. Oxford: Archaeopress. .
*Edward Impey (born 1962), British historian, archaeologist, and museum curator
Mellanby married twice. His first wife, Helen Nielson Dow Mellanby, was a biologist and medical doctor; they had a daughter, biochemist Jane Mellanby. One of his grandsons is curator Edward Impey.
Along with Edward Impey, Goodall is a patron of the Castle Studies Trust, a UK registered charity founded in 2012.
*Edward Impey (born 28 May 1962) British historian, archaeologist, and museum curator
Mellanby married zoologist and curator Oliver R. Impey in 1961. They had four children, including Edward Impey. She was widowed when Impey died in 2005; she died from cancer in 2021, aged 82 years.
